question: 趣
sourceMnemonic:
The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well. 
This word covers a lot of meanings so it can be <vocabulary>charm</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>taste</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>vibe</vocabulary>, or even <vocabulary>gist</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: If something has <vocabulary>charm</vocabulary>, your thought/<ja>思</ja> (<ja>おも</ja>) goes in that direction/<ja>向き</ja> (<ja>むき</ja>).  You feel the vibe? Do you get the gist?
